intro: Forsteronia pubescens var. placida, commonly known as the velvetleaf forsteronia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. Native to tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in warm, humid climates. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a soft, pubescent texture. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
